attributes.action: make it legal to revoke a step parent adoption
attributes.background:
I have parental responsibility over a child i have no actual connection with.
I feel in the long run the adoption does not benefit the child and could possibly harm them in the future when they are old enough to understand.
The situation i am in is harming my mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
I was in a same sex relationship and adopted my at the time partners child.
We are no longer together and myself and the child have no relationship.
Divorce is an option for married couples with no blood connection, step parents should also have this option when it does not harm the child.

attributes.action: Require 30% of all restaurant tips to go towards chefs
attributes.background: The chefs work as hard or maybe even more so it is only fair they get some of the tips. Seeing as most chefs earn a bit less than waiters in most places and work twice as hard at most times.
attributes.additional_details: I have worked in many kitchens where no tips have been cut and have always been unfair and so do many people. I now work in a place where the tips get cut by 40% so that the kitchen has a little extra in their pocket, and it works so great and gives us an extra goal to work towards.

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Make teachers do inset day training in school holidays
attributes.background: School Inset days drastically effect working families and all training should be done during school holidays so as not to effect families daily routines as well as the pupils everyday learning
attributes.additional_details: Teachers set inset days usually just after school restarts from school holidays so why can they not do them during the free 13 weeks they have each year

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be £9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of £7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Stop HGV vehicles using the third lane on four lane motorway sections.
attributes.background: Stop sections of motorways slowing to a crawl and causing long tail backs across three lanes.
attributes.additional_details: When HGV  vehicles block three lanes it cause other drivers to drive erratically to get past.

attributes.action: Charge cyclists road tax and insurance,require to have side mirrors by law
attributes.background: Cyclists causes accidents ,damages and hold us drivers up . They should pay insurance in case they damage cars or are involved in rtc.they use our roads so they should pay some  road tax! Accidents could be prevented if riders were required to use Mirrors so they don't just pull out in front of us!
attributes.additional_details: They cause traffic ques. They have hold us up and we pay to use the road ...

attributes.action: Allow Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya to claim UK asylum via the UNHCR.
attributes.background: The UK only allows asylum claims from people who are on its sovereign territory. Hence English speaking Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya cannot apply for asylum in the UK. Canda and the USA allow such people to apply for resettlement via the UNHCR while still in Kenya. The UK should do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

http://www.washingtonblade.com/2016/04/22/report-anti-lgbt-persecution-increased-under-uganda-law/

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-groundtruth-project/inside-the-nightmares-of_b_7674502.html

http://rainbowrailroad.ca/whatwedo

http://www.hias.org/work/resettling-refugees

http://hamiam.de/en/

attributes.action: Remove or greatly increase the petition character limit, currently capped at 880
attributes.background: The current character limit in petition descriptions is too small to include a highly meaningful body of evidence, argument, and other relevant information. Governmental ability to reply to petitions is notably unencumbered. People should be able to engage in responsive dialogue with the government.
attributes.additional_details: Many members of the public are informed on an extensive variety of subjects, ranging from obscure and niche, to popular and general interest. These people are ideally suited to approach the government via petition, to better educate the public and government alike. However, current character limitations means only small fragments of their expertise can be represented. Given the government's latitude in ability to respond to these petitions, the public should be granted similar levels of freedom.

attributes.action: Provide income tax relief and remove insurance premium tax on health insurance.
attributes.background: The affordability and rapid uptake in the number of individuals and employing organisations taking out private health insurance across the uk would immediately ease the current pressure on the NHS. There would also be a rapid growth of private sector health care in the uk providing economic benefit.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently no financial incentive for individuals or organisations to take out private health care insurance.The NHS is left to pick up all the workloads and costs of large numbers of the uk population who would by choice move into private sector health care provision if the cost of premiums were lowered by incentives. This would rapidly reduce the demand on NHS services across the uk now and for the foreseeable future and stimulate growth and investment in private health care provision.

attributes.action: Make schools have nit nurses back and children with lice stay home.
attributes.background: Are you sick and tired of your children getting headlice because parents are forced to send their children to school with headlice, as schools see education been more important than health? I certainly am. Help to get nit nurses back into schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of children with headlice are been harrassed to send their children to school and the spread of lice continues. 
They think if a childs hair is tied up they can not be spread. Wrong.
They think as long as your actively trying to get rid of them, the child should be in school. Wrong.
Children with headlice should be kept off school until the headlice are completely gone and the nit nurse should be able to check before allowing a child back into school. 
A once a week visit would sufice.

attributes.action: GCSE students should study their chosen subject from year 8.
attributes.background: I believe studying a GCSE is incredibly hard from personal experience, I have found that learning and subject for less that 2 years at GCSE isn't very usefully as it's hard to lear alll the content I believe that from year 8 we should start doing GCSE work because it would alllow for more practice.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, students would be benefited from this because their work would actually be at use by the time exams come around. Learning for year 8 would allow year 7 to be a year where you deciede what subjects you want to take at GCSE and with 4 years of learning this would allow students to possibly take on more GCSEs due to the increased learning time.

attributes.action: Make Ofsted Inspections in Schools a regular, unexpected thing without knowing
attributes.background: Teachers change how they teach and behave when ofsted are at the school. I think that ofsted should be unexpected and should be a last minute thing for teachers to know.

attributes.action: Leaving Care age to be raised to the August after 18th birthday if in education
attributes.background: Care leavers aged 18 in full time education should be classed as 'eligible' or 'relevant' until the 31st August after their 18th Birthday, to be entitled to accommodation and maintenance. This ceases at 18, when they become 'former relevant'. It is unfair to have to study whilst setting up a home.
attributes.additional_details:
The percentage of care leavers in further and higher education is statistically lower than their peers. Being able to manage and complete their education may prove to be a struggle when leaving care.
In terms of child benefit entitlement, a ‘qualifying young person’ can be aged 18 and 19 in full-time education. This extends financial support to young people post-18. Care leavers should have their support extended to the same age as they are some of the most vulnerable people in society.

attributes.action: Investigate the true scale of female genital mutilation within the UK.
attributes.background: Female genital mutilation is not required by any religion.It is a barbaric ancient cultural practice that exisisted before Islam, Christianity or Judaism.It serves no medical purpose and destroys young girls lives.
attributes.additional_details: Female genital mutilation is illegal in the UK and involvement in its practice can result in prosecution and a 14 year prison sentence.Despite this, thousands of cases are reported by Doctors, Hospitals, and support groups every year in the UK and yet their has not being one successful prosecution.This must be investigated.The UK should be the standard bearer to the rest of the world with a zero tolerance approach and commitment to eradicate its practice.

attributes.action: List the common hedgehog (Erinaceus europaeus) as an endangered species.
attributes.background: The Government do not believe it is appropriate to list hedgehogs as a protected species, which is best reserved for species deliberately killed or injured by humans. I had a hedgehog in my garden last summer - first in years.  Then found it in the back alley, stamped to death. They need protecting.
attributes.additional_details:
One dead hedgehog killed deliberately by humans is one dead hedgehog too many. Results of the BBC Gardeners’ World Magazine's annual wildlife survey show that 51% of people did not see a hedgehog at all in 2016, up from 48% in 2015. Just 12% saw a hedgehog regularly.  This poll’s result is in line other recent polls by the People’s Trust for Endangered Species and the RSPB.

http://www.discoverwildlife.com/news/survey-results-reveal-sharp-decline-hedgehog-sightings

attributes.action: Make fake news reporting by the media a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Fake news stories should never make it to broadcast status or be publicised.
All corporate media outlets whether broadcast news or printed should have to verify, validate and publicise their sources for reports or face criminal charges and heavy financial penalties for disseminating fake news.
attributes.additional_details:
Fake news is a scourge and has been for some considerable time.
It creates distrust of information that is supposed to inform the public.
News media outlets are no longer reliable sources of unbiased news, they are in fact attempting to make news and drive public opinion politically in directions favourable to their owners own views.
The aim of the media is apparently to hold governments and others to account, yet no one is holding the media to account for faking news reports.

attributes.action: Grant automatic asylum to any unaccompanied, displaced child seeking help
attributes.background:
Our MP's recently voted by a majority, to reject a plan for Britain to give shelter and asylum to Syrian children who had arrived in Europe unaccompanied. 
It should be compulsory for our government to grant asylum to vulnerable unaccompanied children, wether orphaned or seperated from family.

attributes.action: Allow town councils to set their own business rates
attributes.background: Small towns across the U.K. Are suffering from empty shops due in part to excessive business rates. These rates should be set locally and councils should be able to suspend temporarily in order to boast local business.
attributes.additional_details: Currently rates are set by the valuation office. They need to be set locally based on requirements and economic growth.

attributes.action: Tattoos legal for 16 years olds with parental consent
attributes.background: I believe that as long as there is a parent present or on the phone when the child wants the tattoo then that is acceptable because I'm sure a parent wouldn't let their 16 year old get something tattooed that they will obviously regret in the future and the parent will want to know what it is before
attributes.additional_details: I'm 16 years old and personally I want a tattoo my mum found no reason as to why I shouldn't have one as it's not something inappropriate that I will want to have removed or covered up and i believe that a parents opinion matters as if I was to get a tattoo without my parents consent I'm more likely to get an unsuitable, unacceptable or regrettable tattoo I understand some parents don't want their child being tattooed thats why I think it is fair to have parental consent beforehand

attributes.action: TAX non-reusable sanitary products & give out free reusable pads, cups & nappies
attributes.background:
'Disposable' items such as tampon applicators and wipes pollute our beaches, end up in landfill, and Kill wildlife.
With the revenue generated from the TAX, give out free reusable pads, cups and nappies.
If there is any money leftover this should go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish.
attributes.additional_details:
www.facebook.com/keeptampontax/

https://www.theguardian.com/vital-signs/2015/feb/12/science-plastic-oceans-study-fish-pollution-worse

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/21/flushing-tampons-toilet-blocks-drains-sanitary-products

attributes.action: End the discriminatory frozen overseas UK state pension policy in many countries
attributes.background: British pensioners who retire to over 120 countries, mainly Commonwealth, have their rightful state pension frozen impacting lives of 550,000 yet those retiring to other countries have their pension uprated annually, just as though they never left UK. This is discriminatory and causes huge anguish.
attributes.additional_details: More than 95% of the ‘frozen’ pensioners live in Commonwealth countries.The National Insurance Fund is built up from member contributions, including contributions from those who are now frozen! It would cost less than 1% of the annual pension bill to unfreeze pensions. Pensions frozen Australia, Canada, New Zealand, most Commonwealth Countries, and many others. A reciprocal agreement is not needed before they can unfreeze frozen pensions, a simple stroke of the pen could do it.

attributes.action: Student maintenance loans to include parental outgoings as well as incomings
attributes.background: When a student applies for a maintenance loan through Student Finance UK, they have to declare their total annual household income. Whilst this may be effective for the upper and lower class, many of the middle class families lose out substantially.
attributes.additional_details: With a maximum loan of 8,200 for students with an annual household income of less than £25,000, no financial aid is expected of their parents or guardians. However, despite a student turning 18, being a separate legal entity to their parents or guardians, parents are expected to help despite their outgoings. Annual household incomes over £62,177 allow students to be entitled to a £3,821 loan. With accomodation nearly always over this amount, parents are expected to help to the extent of £5,000.

attributes.action: To put extra funding into the NHS .
attributes.background:
We all know about the plight of the NHS , stop using it as a political football , too many Governments past and present have failed the NHS .
At least bring us into line with other European countries as far as funding goes.
Suspend foreign aid or increase Income Tax and N.I. Contributions.

attributes.action: STOP THE BAN ON MENTHOL CIGARETTES
attributes.background:
Menthol cigarettes are about to become illegal.

Under new tobacco laws, menthol flavour in cigarettes will be phased out over the next four years – ready for a complete ban on May 20, 2020.
attributes.additional_details: As a smoker trying to cut down I've found menthol cigarettes to be a stepping stone to cut down to around 5 cigarettes a day from around 30. With the withdrawal of menthol cigarettes people will turn to illegal ways to get hold of them. Crime and costs for the government will rocket. Also people won't have an effective way to stop so problems will get worse. Also cigarettes will be no longer sold in packs of ten so this will encourage harsher smoking and will cost more on the NHS. STOP THE BAN

attributes.action: Institute a Parliamentary medal  for an  historic contribution to  democracy
attributes.background:
This award will be specifically for contributions to parliamentary democracy as distinct from other types of contributions to public life or to the work of the government or the crown.

 The model should be the Congressional Gold Medal of the United States
attributes.additional_details: For example without the actions of a private citizen Gina Miller  Article 50 would not have been debated in parliament. Gina a private citizen lead a movement resulting in  a historic Supreme Court judgement which will resound down the ages and clarify  the balance of power between parliament and the government. Such a historic contribution to parliamentary democracy should be recognised by the Gold Medal.

attributes.action: Make the Home Office settlement application process fair, transparent and smooth
attributes.background: The Home Office charge average of £2000 for each settlment application which takes up to 6 months for standard applicaiton outside the UK. The settlment processing times unfailry vary, affecting a lot of British families and make them live their life apart waiting for Home office deicision.
attributes.additional_details:
The home office currently charge very high fees for settment process submitted out of the U.K and make the process unfair and unnessarily very lengthy.

If you pay additionaly £450 you can get the application considrered in 3 weeks instead of 6 months. Other countries in Europe process the applications fairly, quickly and accurately reliable on integrity of the applicaiotn rather thatn purely on fees paid. 

On top of the applicaiton fee, you have to pay for health insurance additionaly - even if you are covered by international health insurance. 

In many cases, Home Office makes plain wrong immigration decisions  , which makes life for these families unbearable , having to wait about 1 to 2 years to solve their appeals through the courts to rectify the wrong decisions.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on abolishing the British Monarchy
attributes.background: Currently, Britain has an unelected Head of State who is unelected and unaccountable. The Queen has rule over all laws that are made in the UK, but doesn't even help make them in the first place. She has consistently shown a lack of any leadership; recently in regards to Donald Trump's state visit.
attributes.additional_details: The Queen has to pass every law made and has the power to veto them. This is not democracy, this is proof that Britain is stuck in the past and desperately needs modernisation. After Britain voted to leave the EU, it is clear that we no longer want people who are unelected ruling over us. A referendum, whatever result is produced, will give the Queen a mandate to leave or lead; it is time to take back democracy.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Make labelling GMO foods mandatory.
attributes.background: It is still unsure as to the health effects of Genetically Modified Organism's and there is evidence to support the unsustainablility of GMO's in future agriculture.

attributes.action: Make it law all cars sold  that the driving licence Number of new keeper ON V5
attributes.background: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the communites of the UK

Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Force Councils to fix the roads throughout England
attributes.background: Within the Northwest alone roads are dangerous cars are avoiding pot holes which in turn could result in a possibly fatal accident. Not only only is this unsafe the overall cost could potentially be higher than if the councils hired someone to fix the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Manchester roads have deep visible cracks which could result in a sink hole, Rochdale roads have potholes inches deep, something needs to be done before an accident occurs.

attributes.action: Make people register for gig tickets before the sale to stop hackers and touts
attributes.background: Its unfair that true fans are missing out on getting tickets to see their favourite artists due to hackers,computer programmes and touts buying tickets in high volumes and re-selling seconds after the tours selling out for extortionate amounts, lets make a registration like glastonbury stand for all

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my fiancé takes out our kids and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! He either has to use the floor or do it in the car which isnt ideal. There are so many more involved dads nowadays, we need to make things more accessible for them too!

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: Make it so students can choose a certain method for exams.
attributes.background: Make it so that students can take one of four options for exams at A-level and GCSE: Written, Vocal, Coursework base or practical in as many subjects as possible and the student can decide what type of examination method they want to be tested by.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Lower university fees down to £3,000 as they were before 2012.
attributes.background: People want to access further education but don't have the necessary funds to support themselves. By lowering the fees students will not leave university with crippling debts.

attributes.action: Make it law for all animal care workers to be animal first aid trained.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, it is not a legal requirement for animal care workers e.g. groomers, pet sitters, dog walkers, animal trainers and animal boarding, to have any animal first aid training. Through this petition we want pets to have the best care possible and ensure their welfare is paramount.
attributes.additional_details:
With this petition, we ask that it become law that ALL animal care workers have pet first aid training. As with all work places that legally must have human first aid qualified staff, we recommend that all animal-based businesses also have the same controls and measures in place that ensure staff are animal first aid trained.
Further, that animal care workers commit to undertake and continue with CPD, throughout their careers, to ensure that they have up-to-date animal first aid qualifications.

attributes.action: Make braces free for any child with a teeth issue.
attributes.background: Braces are ridiculously expensive, ranging from £1000 to £2000. Any under 18 with a teeth issue should receive free braces from the NHS, not just children with severe teeth issues.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the relationship between the UK and the EU after the exit.
attributes.background: Give the citizens of the United Kingdom the opportunity to decide if they want to maintain the access to the European Single Market without being a member of the European Union, either through a membership of the European Economic Area or through bilateral treaties (Swiss paradigm).

attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads

attributes.action: Put the Investigatory Powers Bill to a referendum.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill is a piece of legislation that seriously infringes our right to a private life. The bill has been scarcely covered in the media and I believe that the British people should be given the opportunity to decide for themselves whether we are willing to give up our freedoms.
attributes.additional_details:
I urge everyone who reads this to do some extra research on the Investigatory Powers Bill, and other similar mass surveillance programs around the world, such as the NSA's Prism program. Please look up interviews from Edward Snowden and decide for yourself whether he is a traitor or a hero.

If the people decide that these programs and losing our rights are a worthy sacrifice for protection from terrorism then so be it, however, as it stands we have not been given a choice.

attributes.action: Make Religious Education optional
attributes.background: I am in Year 10 and we have to do RE. It is long and boring so I think that it should be optional. I am not religious yet I still have to learn about Christianity and Hinduism.
attributes.additional_details: It shouldn't affect the current Year 10 and 11s but should affect the upcoming Year 10s

attributes.action: Call for an international sporting boycott of the USA due to its discrimination
attributes.background: The US ban on muslim entry ignores several elements of The Geneva convention on Human rights:  "freedom of thought, conscience and religion" , "equality before the law" and "presumption of innocence until proven guilty". The ban will be used as "evidence" to incite and recruit potential terrorists.
attributes.additional_details: Dividing communities and creating an illusion of a war with Islam will provide "evidence" for those trying to recruit followers to terrorist groups. The ban could cause even those whose inclination is against violence to reconsider. It also introduces a dangerous direction of movement for the country which likes to be considered the leader of the free world. The sporting boycott showed South Africa how strongly the world disapproved of apartheid. A sporting Boycott of America would do the same.

attributes.action: International students in U.K should have a standard form of maintenance loan
attributes.background: As an international student I've personally been able to experience firsthand economic struggles at university. International students undoubtedly face economic strain with fees & limitations on their economic welfare the government should be able to place a standardised maintenance loan for us.
attributes.additional_details: Increase in international student fees from last year alone at Universities across the country.
